column4: Hmm, the current intel driver Ubuntu uses is unusable for the Intel Corporation 82845G/GL[Brookdale-G]/GE Chipset. OR 8xx chips.  Ive read about the issue. Just downgrade to the previous intel driver and all things will be fine! :) Why dont they do that ?
I have to contantly move the mouse in order to not have to reboot after the screen does black and wont display graphics again.
I cant set another timeout on the screensaver either, because if i open its gui the screen also goes black :)
you might disable screensaver
How, if not from the screensaver gui ?
are you trying the "i915.modeset=1" workaround?
Yes, but ive not added that grub line, should i ?
it's worth a try. have you tried it and it fixed your issues?
Ill add in that grub line and check. So far, with doing all the other things has not helped much. A bit better. This is an IBM NetVista.
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/Bugs/Lucidi8xxFreezes workaround A. i'm not clear if you have tried it. If you haven't you can add "i915.modeset=1" to grub line on boot to try it.
I even installed those things, new initrd and all. Ill check this grub line as well so ive tried it all.
I can go into the screensaver now :)
Screensaver gui that is
Why dont they just use the old, working intel driver ?
i don't know. this 8xx problem is an embarrasment as far as i'm concerned.
Yeah, why use a less good driver if one wouldnt have to ? :) / Amazing!
to just make grub change stick: in /etc/default/grub you can change/add GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX="i915.modeset=1" and then run update-grub.
Hmm, ok but id rather see an intel driver update that adds this line.

This how easy this could be: Add +1 on the micro or patchlevel versions of the intel driver. Have it add this line to /etc/default/grub and run update-grub. I cant see how this could be bad, can you ?
A very non-bug really. Why are they using the most crappy versions of most anything they can find ?
there was a decision made for 10.04 release, given the state of drivers at the time and the release window. I believe it was an unfortunate happening.
They are using other packages with bugs written against them, but the bugs have already been solved years ago even perhaps.
Thanks very much. This computer works again! :)
A simple grep check for that line in the default grub setup would work perfectly. So easy and yet nothing is beeing done :(
